meanings.definition: The edge of a woven fabric, finished to prevent unraveling.
meanings.sent1: The selvages of the blanket were neatly stitched to keep the threads from coming loose.
meanings.sent2: She carefully trimmed the selvages of the tablecloth before hemming it.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten played with the selvages of the curtains, thinking they were toys.
meanings.sent4: The selvages of society hold us together, preventing chaos from taking over.
meanings.sent5: The bright red selvages of the flag fluttered proudly in the wind.

meanings.definition: The self-finished edge of a piece of fabric.
meanings.sent1: The selvages of the scarf had a unique pattern that matched the design.
meanings.sent2: When sewing a dress, it's important to align the selvages properly for a clean finish.
meanings.sent3: The tailor jokingly referred to the selvages as the 'fancy fringes' of the fabric.
meanings.sent4: Her personality had selvages of kindness that showed through even in tough times.
meanings.sent5: The selvages of the quilt added a touch of elegance to the overall design.
